newsitem.title: USA: Conn. schools to receive 29 pct more U.S. funds.
newsitem.headline: Conn. schools to receive 29 pct more U.S. funds.

text.p: Connecticut's schools will receive $67.01 million, a 29 percent increase from the U.S. Department of Education for programs aimed at improving education for disadvantaged youth, the state's two U.S. senators said on Wednesday.
The state will receive an additional $15.21 million this year, Democratic Senators Chris Dodd and Joe Lieberman said.
They said Connecticut's funding was increased because of a recalculation of census data on poverty levels authorized by the Elementary and Secondary Education Act.
